Header: Local boy Millman beats Sandgren to reach second round in Brisbane
Content: John Millman booked his place in the second round of the Brisbane International on Monday (December 31) with a three set win over USAâ€™s Tennys Sandgren. The home favourite took the first set on a tie-break, before failing to capitalise on a match point in the second set tiebreak. Sandgren levelled the match before receiving a code violation for delaying the match after a toilet visit at the end of the set. The American then failed to win another game as Millman took the third set 6-0, to secure a second round spot. He will take on former world number three Grigor Dimitrov.
